message.content:
cs.DL, cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.CR 

The paper discusses the use of citation analysis to predict delayed recognition of scientific discoveries, which is a topic that falls under the scope of several arXiv CS sub-categories. cs.DL (Digital Libraries) is the most likely category as the paper deals with citation analysis and bibliometrics. cs.IR (Information Retrieval) is also relevant as the paper discusses the use of patent and non-patent literature (NPL) analysis to predict scientific impact. cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) is relevant as the paper discusses the role of citations in scientific communication and impact. cs.CY (Computers and Society) is relevant as the paper discusses the potential transformative impact of scientific discoveries. Finally, cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) is relevant as the paper discusses the potential of citation analysis to identify transformative research ahead of time.
